learning_objective: Explain tradeoffs when selecting and implementing cybersecurity recommendations.
question_str:
{
    "Question": "In the development of a popular online game, the developers discover a potential vulnerability in their security. They propose two fixes: One fix will make the game more secure but may slow down the game's performance. The other fix won't affect game performance, but it also won't be as secure. As a player who values both things, how do you anticipate which solution would be the best route to take?",
    "Answer1": "Choose the more secure solution, players' security should always be paramount",
    "Answer2": "Choose the solution with less impact on the game's performance, as the likelihood of attack may be minimal",
    "Answer3": "Develop and propose a new solution that doesn't compromise game performance and security",
    "Answer4": "Apply both solutions to ensure both performance and security",
    "CorrectAnswer": "3",
    "Explanation": "A balanced solution — one which doesn't overly impinge on either game performance or security — would likely be the best outcome for the majority of players. This, of course, would require additional development (and cost) to achieve, but it would likely be worth it in terms of user satisfaction and security assurance.",
